result.execSummary:
The defendant Montriel Ken G Solomon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
**Restitution amount is pending for verification to Atty Meier.  Joint & severally with 14CF426 & 14CF364.
**AS OF 8-3-15  -  NEW RESTITUTION AMOUNT DUE TO BE PAID JOINT/SEVERALLY WITH CO-DEFTS.**
**Issue of restitution for victim John S held open for 1 year for pending surgery.
Co-Deft Moreno-Arroyo 14CF364 paid the restitution in full

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.    Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
**  Pay restitution plus surcharges; pending verification to Atty Meier.  Joint/severally with 14CF426 & 14CF364.   
May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
 *  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Meier.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Meier states she would like to receive verification of restitution amounts prior to stipulating to them.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 255 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $567.54 joint & several with 14CF364 & 14CF426, the issue of restitution for victim John S is held open for a period of one year.  State to submit restitution order.
Sealed Jury Questions
Exhibits 1-15, 18 & 19, 21 & 22, 24, 29, 31, and 33 inventoried and stored in Br 1 under 14CF365.
Guilty.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Meier.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Jury finds deft guilty.  Court polls jury.  Juror's excused at 2:34pm.  Court enters judgment on verdict.  PSI ordered.  SEH 12/11/14 at 10am.  Bond revoked.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Meier.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Day 2.  Testimony taken from:  KPD Detective Jason Kenesie.  State rests.  Atty Meier moves to dismiss.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Defense rests.  Jury instructions given.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror is #3911, excused at 12:23pm.  Jurors deliberate at 12:25pm.   Verdicts reached at 2:16pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Meier.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Opening statements given.  Testimony taken from:  Andrew S., KPD Officer Nathanael Morenz, KPD Officer Bridgett Heid, KPD Officer Gregory Munnelly, Magnolia B.P., John S, KPD Officer Ryan Alles.  Trial to resume on 10/29/14 at 9am.  Jurors excused at 4pm.  Jury instruction conference held.
4th Amended
in limine; filed by Atty J Meier.

Defendant Montriel Ken G Solomon appeared with Attorney Jodi L. Meier.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Voir Dire began at 1:53 pm; completed at 3:27 pm. Extra jurors released at 3:50. Jurors sworn; opening instructions given to the jurors by The Court. Jurors released for the day at 4:22 and instructed to return at 8:30 am on 10-28-2014.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Meier.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Meier acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Preliminary motions held.  Witnesses are sequestered, with exception of KPD Detective Jason Kenesie.  JS to begin at 1:15pm.

ADA McNeill states she will submit her suggestion for excising the deft's statement by the next hearing.  MH set for 9/19/14 at 11:30am.  Bond continued.
KPD Statement of DE

Plea of not guilty entered to 3rd Amended Information.  Def. concurs with motion to sever filed by Atty Terry Rose on behalf of co-def. Markese Tibbs.  State to submit letter brief.  Motion to sever in Tibbs case set for 9/2/14 at 1:00.  Def. Solomon and Atty Meier to be present, as it effects their case.  Speedy trial was demanded on 8/4/14.  Jury selection 10/27/14 at 9:00 (pick & go).  Bond continued.

to dismiss; filed by Atty J Meier.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jodi Meier. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA McNeill. Def. rejects offer and decides to proceed with preliminary hearing. State withdraws offer. Atty. Meier moves to dismiss counts 2 & 4. Court denies motion. Preliminary hearing held jointly with co-def. KPD Officer Jason Kenesie sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by Atty. Meier. State offers and court receives exhibits S-1 and S-2 into evidence. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 5-6-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Atty. Meier moves to dismiss Cts. 2, 4, & 5. Court denies motion. Bond continued.
